page.title: 02RIVER WYRE & RESERVOIR
page.content: The R.Wyre flows through a winding steep-sided wooded valley and though a swift response to heavy rainfall on the surrounding fells produces rapid changes in level, flooding is not a major problem. It is not navigable and is crossed in this stretch only by two small footbridges. Below Abbeystead a dam was built by Lancaster Corporation in 1853 to supply compensation water for mills (now derelict) downstream. Due to silting the capacity of the present reservoir (less than 14M gallons) is very much smaller than its maximum 185M gallons and its area has been reduced to less than 1/3 its original 60 acres. The water is now controlled by the North-West Water Authority and just below the dam, on each side of the river is an outflow chamber for water diverted via a tunnel from the R.Lune. (see Page 3)
